avdta.network.link

Class CACCLTMLink

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.link.Link
      • avdta.network.link.LTMLink
        • avdta.network.link.CACCLTMLink
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Link>

    public class CACCLTMLink
extends LTMLink
    This models the cooperative adaptive cruise control, which has several effects on vehicle behavior. Vehicles can move even at jam density, and the congested wave speed is much higher. The fundamental diagram is based on the MIXIC car following model.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • CACCLTMLink

        public CACCLTMLink(int id,
                   Node source,
                   Node dest,
                   double capacity,
                   double ffspd,
                   double wavespd1,
                   double jamd,
                   double length,
                   int numLanes)
        Constructs the link with the given parameters. The second congested wave speed is calculated based on the remaining parameters.
        Parameters:
        id - the link id
        source - the source node
        dest - the destination node
        capacity - the capacity per lane (veh/hr)
        ffspd - the free flow speed (mi/hr)
        wavespd1 - the first congested wave speed in the congested regime (mi/hr)
        jamd - the jam density (veh/mi)
        length - the length (mi)
        numLanes - the number of lanes

    • Method Detail

        public static double scaleCapacity(double ffspd)
        Scales the capacity according to MIXIC based on the free flow speed

        the scaled capacity

        public static double scaleWavespd(double ffspd)

        Returns:

        public static boolean checkK2(double capacity,
                              double ffspd,

        Checks whether the length and free flow speed are sufficiently high to allow cooperative adaptive cruise control
        Parameters:
        capacity - the capacity (veh/hr)
        ffspd - the free flow speed (mi/hr)
        length - the length (mi)
        Returns:
        whether the fundamental diagram is valid
